name: Blue Horizon Hotel

reviews.text: Great location near Robson and Burrard streets - within a short walking distance of many shops and restaurants. 10-12 blocks from Gastown. We stayed on the 22nd floor in a spacious, clean room with a balcony offering great views of the city and harbor. Overall, good value.
reviews.title: Great location, high floors offer nice views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a pleasure to spend a few days @ the blue horizon. Location was perfect & staff was very helpful during an extremely busy tourist season............... this hotel was close to everything......
reviews.title: FAB!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely stay there again!!!
reviews.title: A nice place

reviews.text: We just spent two nights in the hotel, prior to our cruise to Alaska that left from Vancouver.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.text: This is the second time we've stayed at this property; the time previous was several years ago.
reviews.title: Excellent value and service

reviews.text: Each floor of the Blue Horizon has 6 rooms, our group had half of them on the 20th floor. Two were the two queen bed type and the other a single king bed. All had great views, room 2001 had the very best view though. I was extremely pleased that the hotel was able to accomodate my request that we all be on the same floor. They also gave us a bonus of a higher floor than we had paid for.
reviews.title: Several nice bonuses at the Blue Horizon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I first booked these rooms, I was told that they did not have wifi, but booked anyway although I knew we would miss being connected. In the time between booking and arriving they had added the wifi. It did cut out a bit, but we were pleased to have it.
reviews.title: Still excellent

reviews.text: All of the rooms were spacious and clean with comfy beds. Rooms were furnished well, and had a coffee machine, fridge, flat screen TV and a balcony. The bathrooms although not huge were perfectly acceptable and worked well.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: As other reviewers have noted this hotel is very well situated and it is walking distance to almost all of the big attractions. One member of the group used the parking facilites with no problems. There is a small pool, best enjoyed by children and a sauna and exercise machine area. They have a restaurant called Inlets on the ground floor. The staff at the restaurant are very accomodating, although the food is mediocre. The front desk staff had a brochure they had created that outlined where some of the better Vancouver restaurants were. This was very useful to us. Although we didn't interact with the staff frequently, when we did they were helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Amazing Staff!!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights this visit, have stayed here about 10 years ago and would happily visit again.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned home from a 4 night stay at the Blue Horizon Hotel on Robson St. in down town Vancouver. What a great hotel. Very clean, very comfortable, nice big room, friendly staff, plus close to everything in the Vancouver city area that you would want to see and do. Their lobby restaurant had a great menu and the food was very good. You had the choice to eat inside or out on the extended sidewalk area for people watching. We never had to adjust the air-conditioning as our room was a perfect temperature all the time. We always had a good sleep as the bed was very comfy with 2 fluffy pillows per person. Would I go back... yes, would I reccomend to others... for sure. Enjoy your stay, we did!
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Blue Horizon Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blue Horizon for 2 nights in July as part of a longer trip in and around Vancouver. The location was central, the staff helpful and friendly and the rooms were nice, if a little business-like. As we were out sightseeing, we didn’t spend that much time in the hotel but nonetheless found it to be clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Central location, clean and comfortable

reviews.text: Stayed for business. Hotels in Vancouver are quite expensive and this was in this category. Expect to get less for your money than in Europe.
reviews.title: Ordinary hotel with large rooms in shopping district

reviews.text: Wifi was fast and reliable
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was large, but bathroom pretty small with a very small bath meaning showers were expected to be used all the time.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blue Horizon after our cruise from Alaska. Its in walking distance to the cruise ship docks.The hotel has fabulous large rooms. The most comfortable bed of the entire trip. Spectacular view of the city with a small balcony. On the main strip and in walking distance to most of the city sites/neighborhoods. Also most tour busses/shuttles stop in front of the hotel. The staff was very helpful with everything from directions, dining suggestions, sites to visit, best places for exchanging $$ etc. When staying in the hotel, have breakfast in their restaurant. Their veggie and their salmon eggs benedict are absolutely delicious!!! There's a great gelato place across the street for when you want some sweets too! Highly recommend!!!
reviews.title: Perfect location & beautiful view!!!

reviews.text: This is an older hotel but quite well maintained. Position is great on Robson Street close to all the shops and an easy walk to just about anywhere downtown and to the harbour. Check-in was firiendly and efficient and any queries I had during the stay were promptly and politely dealt with.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: All rooms have a balcony with views of some kind. Pricing was excellent for the quality of the establishment and for the position. The restaurant is perhaps a little limited in offering but I could not fault the service.
reviews.title: Love It - Would Stay Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is the lack of complimentary wifi. This is the 21st century and I see no reason to charge extra for it. That would have made my rating 5/5. However, notwithstanding, I'd stay here on my next visit to beautiful Vancouver without hesitation.
reviews.title: Excellent Views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. Stayed for two days and had a great time.
reviews.title: Visit to Vancover

description: Ideally located in the heart of Robson Street downtown Vancouver. A dynamic area with fashionable shops, sidewalk cafes, restaurants and night time entertainment. All guest rooms beautifully appointed corner rooms with private balconies, many with spectacular views. FREE high speed Internet access (WIFI) in all guest rooms,lobby, restaurant and lounge. Some of the many amenities include, fridges, coffee makers, large in-room safes, voice messaging, large flat screen TV, pay per view movies, ironing boards and irons, bathrobes, hairdryer. Indoor swimming pool, sauna, Jacuzzi, tread mills and eliptical trainer. Lobby restaurant and Lounge.
